metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6796 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A content process could have modified shared memory relating to crash reporting information, crash itself, and cause an out-of-bound write. This could have caused memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 73 and Firefox < ESR68.5.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6796` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '73.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
